meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring the speed of a rotating shaft, typically in a motor vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The tachometer in the car shows how fast the engine is spinning.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic checked the tachometer to see if the engine was running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The tachometer decided to take a break from counting rotations and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a tachometer, always tracking every movement in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tachometer hummed softly as it recorded the speed of the spinning wheel.

meanings.definition: A device used to indicate the revolutions per minute of a rotating object.
meanings.sent1: The tachometer on the drill showed how fast it was spinning.
meanings.sent2: The pilot glanced at the tachometer to ensure the helicopter was stable.
meanings.sent3: The tachometer at the carnival spun so fast it made everyone dizzy.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down, each moment ticking by like a tachometer.
meanings.sent5: The tachometer beeped loudly, signaling a sudden increase in rotation speed.
